titleStmt.title: Varieties of villany as murther, maiming, theft, perjury upon perjury. And many other infamous matters, set forth at large, and published, in the case (with its proofs and evidences) of John Praed, respondent, to the appeal of VVilliam VVarre. VVhich came to a hearing at the bar of the House of Lords, on the 27th of January 1692/3, and went for the respondent nemisie contradicente.
titleStmt.author: Praed, John, fl. 1711.

titleStmt.title: Varieties of villany as murther, maiming, theft, perjury upon perjury. publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Abel Roper in Fleetstreet, and S. Bristol in Covent-Garden,

notesStmt.note: Cropped with some loss of print.
